derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from steeple (because originally a steeple marked the finishing point across country) + chase

entry.def: A steeplechase is a long horse race in which the horses have to jump over obstacles such as hedges and water jumps.
A steeplechase is a 3000 metres race around a track, during which people jump over obstacles and water jumps.

means.word_mean: 1. a footrace of usually 3000 meters over a closed track with hurdles and a water jump
2. a horse race over an obstructed course
